There are people this morning that have no idea why we meet the way that we do, of the hope that we have, the peace and the joy that we have. Why? Because we love Jesus in a personal way like we do. For many this morning, Easter is a commercial holiday. Many as our society continues to change, they just don't even regard it as anything. But for us, it's a precious day. And every Sunday is a precious day. What I pray that God would help us to remember as we think about these ladies on that first resurrection morning, that they were given an assignment and we've been given an assignment. Go, he says, go quickly and tell them why because it's urgent. I think in closing this morning about the truth of the book of Esther, some of you are familiar with the book of Esther, Mordecai hated the Jewish people. He'd convinced the king to sign a death warrant, sorry, Haman, Mordecai was helpful, sorry. Haman hated the Jews and Haman had convinced the king to sign really a death warrant for all the Jews. And they were under the law of the Medes and Persians and it had been signed and we find that after Haman is exposed and Haman is dealt with that Mordecai and Esther come before the king Ahasuerus. And as they have an opportunity to stand before there, they ask that there be some changes and as you read through the eighth chapter of the book of Esther, you find that there's a counter decree that is written. And it's interesting as you read that counter decree that you'll find that they distributed that counter decree with haste. That counter decree was given to all those within the kingdom, 127 provinces. We find that Mordecai and Esther were instrumental in getting that message distributed. Why did they have to make haste? Why did they employ the individuals that they did to ensure that the message was scattered as it was? Because many would die if they weren't aware of that counter decree. This morning, there are many that are lost in their sin, they're going to die and go to a Christless eternity. Maybe they think that they could be a good person, they're following some religious teaching, but they don't know the truth of what the Bible says. When Jesus said, I am the way, the truth, and the life. No man cometh unto the Father, but by me. I'm thankful that though there was a wicked Haman that sought to destroy the Jews, that there were faithful Mordecai and Esther. And they got the counter decree distributed. Oh, Zion haste is a song that we sing. Oh, there'd be some urgency amongst God's people. As we've been to the empty tomb, we've accompanied Mary Magdalene and the other Mary, we've considered their approach and their arrival, but we see their assignment. We say this morning that as we leave, God too has given me an assignment. We know that God would help us to be faithful to give the message that Jesus saves. Let's pray together. Father, how we love you. We thank you for loving us. We thank you for the truth of your word. We thank you, God, for the opportunity that we have to visit the empty tomb in our sanctified imaginations this morning. We have the opportunity through reading the record that you've provided us with to accompany these ladies early on resurrection morning. God, I pray you would help us to make some application in our lives, help us to rejoice greatly that we serve a risen Savior. God, help us to understand that you too have given us an assignment and I pray that you would help us to go with urgency, that we'd go in obedience to deliver a message to a lost and dying world. Help us to understand that we've simply been entrusted with the gospel, that we are debtors. Help us to be not ashamed. Father, if there's one here that's never been saved, they've never trusted the Lord Jesus Christ as their personal Savior, I pray that you'd move and work as only you can. I pray that today would be the day of their salvation. Lord, they would not delay, not put it off another moment. If there's a measure of uncertainty, oh God, I pray they'd get it settled today. Would you move and work in hearts and lives as only you can. We'll give you the glory for all that you'll do, for it's in Christ's name we pray. Would you stand with me? Heads are bowed and eyes are closed. As our custom is at the end of each of our services, we have the opportunity to have an invitation where we invite you, give you the opportunity to respond to the preaching of God's precious Word. If you're not sure of heaven, we'd love to take a Bible and show you how you could know for sure that heaven's your home. Please, please don't leave this place without knowing for sure, with 100% confidence, that if you're to take your final breath today, that heaven is your home. Maybe this morning you need to come and make a commitment that you'll be obedient to the assignment that we've been given. As Kate plays, the altar is open. Amen. Amen. Amen.
